intro: Gravesia glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular gravesia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its fragrant, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded or semi-shaded environments. The genus Gravesia is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and economically important plants.
